alert.note: Alert for City of Suffolk; Isle of Wight; James City (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 10:07PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, City of Chesapeake, City of Hampton, City of Newport News, City of Norfolk, City of Poquoson, City of Portsmouth, City of Suffolk, City of Virginia Beach, Isle of Wight, James City and York. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Hampton, Smithfield, Windsor, Churchland, Deep Creek, Downtown Suffolk, Old Dominion University, Downtown Portsmouth, Downtown Norfolk, Norfolk State University, Christopher Newport University, Hampton University, Ocean View, Great Bridge, Langley AFB, Regent University, Virginia Wesleyan University and Patrick Henry Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: City of Suffolk; Isle of Wight; James City
